intro: Hieracium macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are rough and hairy, and stems that are hairy as well. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium macrocalyx is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
